subject: Real Estate
title: Adjustable-Rate Mortgage Traps
description: A 60-second lesson on Adjustable-Rate Mortgage Traps.

hook.text: The payment starts low and stays low â€” for exactly two years. Then it jumps.

buildup.text: Adjustable-rate mortgages (ARMs) offer a teaser rate, then reset based on a market index.

discovery.text: Borrowers in the mid-2000s took ARMs assuming they'd refinance before the reset. Many couldn't.

twist.text: When rates spiked, monthly payments doubled. Families who could afford the teaser couldn't afford reality.

climax.text: ARMs aren't inherently bad, but they punish borrowers who don't understand the reset calendar.

punchline.text: A low rate is only as good as its expiration date.

quiz.question: What happens when an adjustable-rate mortgage resets?
options: The rate adjusts to a market index, often increasing
